BD - Data Loader is primarily used for importing and exporting data, not metadata and Change sets are a user-friendly way to deploy metadata between sandboxes and production orgs, but they are not available in Developer Edition organizations.

questions.question_text: Which two deployment tools can be used to deploy metadata from a Developer Edition organization to another organization? (Choose two.)

An administrator has unchecked the `Enable content pack creation` checkbox after users had created content packs.
What is the impact of this change?

choices.B: All existing content packs will be deleted
choices.A: Users can modify the description and title of existing packs
choices.C: Users can continue to edit the contents of existing packs
choices.D: The Clone & Customize button will continue to be available

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When the "Enable content pack creation" checkbox is unchecked, it prevents users from creating new content packs, but it does not affect the ability to interact with existing content packs.
Here’s the impact of unchecking this option:
Users can continue to edit the contents of existing packs because existing content packs remain available for modification, even though new ones can no longer be created.
Content pack creation will be disabled for new packs, but users who already have existing content packs can still view and modify their content (e.g., adding or removing files) from those packs.
A is the correct answer

Content pack is retired I guess?
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000351309&type=1
Looks like A is correct.

Enable content pack creation
If this option is checked, the Create New | Content Pack option displays on the Libraries tab and users can create content packs from any documents or files in their Salesforce CRM Content private or public libraries.
If this option isn’t checked after users in your organization have already created content packs, those packs aren’t deleted and users can continue to modify metadata such as description, title, and custom fields. However, after content pack creation is no longer enabled, users can’t customize or modify existing packs. Specifically, the Clone & Customize button and the Edit | Edit Content Pack option on the content details page are unavailable.

Not sure of the answer after reading this above.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.content_settings.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
I think it's C. Usually, if this is happening, there's a conflict with automations.
https://blog.internetcreations.com/2020/04/why-you-should-consider-process-builder-consolidation/#.ZEUqwS8w0UE

C:To resolve this issue, the administrator should investigate the automation processes that may be causing the phone number field to revert back to an old value. Some possibilities to consider include workflow rules, process builder flows, and triggers. Once the culprit process has been identified, the administrator can make any necessary changes or updates to prevent the issue from occurring. So, the answer would be to "Consolidate automation tools."

questions.question_text:
Sales reps at AW Computing have been reporting that contact phone numbers sometimes revert back to an old value after being updated.

What should the administrator do to resolve this issue?

An administrator created a new custom object. When trying to upload new records to the custom object using Data Loader, they are unable to see the new custom object in the list of available objects.

What should the administrator do to resolve the issue?

choices.C: Assign a permission set to give them access to the new object.
choices.B: Ensure Allow Sharing is checked on the custom object.
choices.A: Check the Field-Level Security of the new custom object’s Name field.
choices.D: Confirm the object is marked as deployed and not in development.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.deploying_custom_objects.htm&type=5

What should the administrator recommend?

choices.C: Assign the users a new permission set.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
